tweet: Meta’s Llama offers free model weights under an EU AI Act exemption as a form of open source, though its use restrictions make it fall short of traditional open-source definitions. It’s a clear trade-off between transparency and regulatory caution.

Gemma 3’s QAT models cut memory use to 15–22GB without losing BF16-like quality, making powerful AI more accessible on consumer GPUs. A clear win for users wanting efficient, high-performance solutions at home.

Ilya Sutskever’s startup hit a $30B valuation based on its promise in AI safety and superintelligence despite lacking a full product. It shows how reputation and potential are reshaping trust in emerging AI ventures.
AI video generation now runs on gaming GPUs with just 6GB of VRAM using optimized software like Framepack. A smart step that could really democratize creative AI tools.
The response clarifies that a direct output isn’t possible and a summary is available instead. It serves as a reminder that constraints often lead to alternative solutions.
